decks.notes: The main concept of this Temur Aggro deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format is to aggressively play low-cost cards and quickly build up board presence while utilizing burn spells and pump effects to push through damage and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to efficiently use cantrips and card draw to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent, while also leveraging the graveyard with cards like Underworld Breach for additional resources. By combining proactive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck seeks to close out games swiftly.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggression and disruption, aiming to quickly overwhelm opponents with a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By combining powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Grief with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Terminate, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The deck also includes some versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to clear the way for its creatures. Additionally, the deck incorporates some powerful late-game threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to close out the game if needed.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox of choices for different situations. By using cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Chord of Calling, it can assemble powerful combos to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. The deck is designed to be flexible and adaptive, able to respond to different threats and strategies while maintaining a strong presence on the battlefield through a combination of creature abilities and efficient mana usage.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient and aggressive creatures such as Wild Nacatl, Territorial Kavu, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also supporting the aggressive game plan. Additionally, Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt provide direct damage to finish off the opponent. The deck also features a companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional value and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced aggression and disruption.

This deck revolves around quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and using them to control the battlefield while pressuring the opponent. It also relies on artifacts to ramp up mana and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to quickly put strong threats on the board and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, it has some control elements with cards like All Is Dust and Karn, the Great Creator to handle any obstacles the opponent may present.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty, while also utilizing cards like Persist and Thoughtseize for disruption. The deck also includes a land destruction package with Pillage the Bog and Dwarven Mine, alongside versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push. The inclusion of Wrenn and Six helps with card advantage and synergy with the land base. The deck aims to win through creative and unexpected plays, utilizing a mix of combo, disruption, and aggression.

The main strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Merfolk tribal strategy. The deck focuses on using cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield quickly, while utilizing lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power and toughness of your Merfolk creatures. Additionally, disruptive cards like Tide Shaper and Merfolk Trickster help control the opponent's board while pushing your own game plan forward. The deck aims to establish dominance early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The key concept of this deck is to use Underworld Breach in combination with Moonsnare Prototype, Grinding Station, and Mishra's Bauble to recur powerful artifacts from the graveyard and generate infinite mana and card advantage. The deck aims to set up a combo where it can loop through its deck, eventually winning the game with Thassa's Oracle or dealing damage with Haywire Mite. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional recursion and disruption to help the deck execute its game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor and The One Ring to quickly ramp up mana and play Primeval Titan to search for land support to win quickly. Dryad of the Ilysian Grove provides color fixing and additional land drops, while various lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle provide additional utility and ramp. The goal is to assemble the pieces for a powerful combo turn and overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence. The deck's strategy revolves around setting up the perfect sequence of plays to accelerate into a game-winning position.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures generated through Cascade abilities. By playing spells with Cascade, the player can cast additional spells for free, allowing them to flood the board with threats while controlling the opponent's resources with counter and bounce spells. The deck aims to outpace the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize, utilizing powerful cascading spells like Crashing Footfalls and Shardless Agent to create overwhelming board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a toolbox of creatures to create powerful combos and synergies. By utilizing cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can generate value and control the board state. The creatures in the deck provide a variety of abilities, from sacrificing for value with Young Wolf to creating tokens with Grist, the Hunger Tide. The deck aims to be flexible and adapt to different situations by tutoring for specific creatures with Chord of Calling and utilizing powerful combo interactions.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with different abilities and synergies to create powerful combos and toolbox options. The key strategy is to generate value through sacrificing creatures, creating tokens, and utilizing creature abilities to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to find key pieces using cards like Chord of Calling and Wall of Roots while maintaining a strong presence on the battlefield with resilient creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician. It aims to outvalue the opponent while setting up game-winning combos.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of disruption and efficiency. It aims to quickly deploy threats like Tarmogoyf, Ragavan, and Orcish Bowmasters while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The use of powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six provides additional value and control over the game. The inclusion of Mishra's Research Desk and Urza's Saga adds a unique twist to the strategy, offering additional card advantage and utility. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, disruption, and powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty onto the battlefield, bypassing their mana cost. This combo-focused deck also includes cards like Raucous Theater and Transmogrify to further enhance its creative strategy. Additionally, the deck contains a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, as well as disruption cards like Thoughtseize to control the opponent while aiming to win through unique and inventive plays.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. Using tutors like Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings, the deck aims to find key pieces like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the game. It also includes powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to close out the game. The inclusion of Sylvan Library and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional card advantage and protection against counterspells, making the deck difficult to deal with.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage quickly. It utilizes cards that can fill the graveyard for cards like Underworld Breach, while also taking advantage of prowess triggers with cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck aims to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent, finishing them off with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. It also has the option to use Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional value.
